body:
### Description

Using `:lua vim.lsp.buf.references()` in a python file with pyright connected produces 2 entries for each reference in the quickfix list. For example:

```
pyfrontal.py|338 col 9| moments = cv.moments(contour[0])
pyfrontal.py|338 col 9| moments = cv.moments(contour[0])
pyfrontal.py|346 col 23| mu_prime_20 = moments["mu20"] / px_area
pyfrontal.py|346 col 23| mu_prime_20 = moments["mu20"] / px_area
pyfrontal.py|347 col 23| mu_prime_02 = moments["mu02"] / px_area
pyfrontal.py|347 col 23| mu_prime_02 = moments["mu02"] / px_area
pyfrontal.py|348 col 23| mu_prime_11 = moments["mu11"] / px_area
pyfrontal.py|348 col 23| mu_prime_11 = moments["mu11"] / px_area
pyfrontal.py|379 col 20| xbar = int(moments["m10"] / px_area)
pyfrontal.py|379 col 20| xbar = int(moments["m10"] / px_area)
```

Only having this issue with pyright. Other language servers are fine.

### Neovim version

```
NVIM v0.9.1
Build type: Release
LuaJIT 2.1.0-beta3

   system vimrc file: "$VIM/sysinit.vim"
  fall-back for $VIM: "
/nix/store/5ksh5vbvdgy0vs2d4p32qlmxg3vbmfld-neovim-unwrapped-0.9.1/share/nvim
"
```

### Nvim-lspconfig version

0d29cad8de3b2c654315203fc1fe12fde722a18a

### Operating system and version

Arch Linux

### Affected language servers

pyright

### Steps to reproduce

1. `nvim file.py`
2. Place cursor onto an appropriate symbol
3. `:lua vim.lsp.buf.references()`
4. QFL is opened with the duplicate references

### Actual behavior

QuickFix List is opened with two entries per reference

### Expected behavior

QuickFix List is opened with a single entry per reference

### Minimal config

```Lua
return {
  {
    'neovim/nvim-lspconfig',

    config = function()

      local lspconfig = require('lspconfig')

      vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd('LspAttach', {
        group = vim.api.nvim_create_augroup('UserLspConfig', {}),
        callback = function(ev)
          local opts_desc = function(d)
            return { buffer = ev.buf, desc = d }
          end

          vim.keymap.set('n', 'gr', vim.lsp.buf.references, opts_desc('Go to references'))
        end,
      })

      lspconfig.pyright.setup {}

      vim.lsp.set_log_level('debug')
    end
  }
}
```


### LSP log
See lines 57-64 of the log for the references request... you can search for each line number in the result and find the duplicates.

https://gist.github.com/carschandler/cadbbdfdf709eb20ee37e535d3e6c69f

comment_data.body: So I have discovered that this is only occurring with one file in one of my projects... Iâ€™ll try to diagnose why it's only happening with that one.

title: List of references is duplicated for pyright
